issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Ohrmazd II on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with eagle's head holding a pearl in its beak and terminating in wing at the back; covered korymbos, two ribbons commencing to the left below the korymbos, pointing upwards; plain diadem, diadem ribbon commencing above ball hair pointing upwards; earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with a row of pearls; double line embellished with a row of pearls running from the shoulders to the breast ornament (the latter not visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy hwrmzdy ('whrmzdy) MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n MNW ctry yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Ohrmazd šāhān šāh Ēran Ēran kē čihr az yazdān| “The Mazda-worshiping divine Ohrmazd, king of kings of the Iranian , whose image| brilliance is from the gods"; dot on chest (SNS 2, var.7)
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square altar shaft; altar ribbons across shaft,to the left and the right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, to the left and right two dots; three altar slabs; above bust with diadem, elaborate coiffure and two balls of hair to the left, surrounded by altar flames; to the left of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Ohrmazd II, holding a barsom in both hands, to the right of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Ahuramazda,holding barsom in both hands, both facing inwards; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 3 h l. o. NWRA ZY, 9 h l. o. 'wrmzdy| ādur ī Ohrmazd | “the fire of Ohrmazd”; dot above ball of hair of the king and on second element of altar table (SNS2, var. 18)
